intro: Conyza domingensis, commonly known as the common horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
